summary: Access refers to the varying degrees of availability and quality of internet use across different regions and populations. It highlights both the enabling and obstructive factors that influence how individuals and communities connect to and utilize internet resources. This encompasses technical, governmental, and commercial dimensions, aiming for a more inclusive and interoperable digital landscape.
excerpt: The article analyzes the fragmentation of the internet, its historical roots, and current forms, highlighting variations in global access and the role of the Internet Society in promoting inclusivity.
